custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the Ticket Dashboard for a team that has digital access enabled
And the user has not yet linked their account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the cell directly below the team matchup will display a message directing the users to link their account
And there will be a 'Link Account' link
And tapping that link will bring the user to the Ticketing Accounts page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to the Ticket Dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a button for the Team Picker on the top left
And the current/next event module below that
And a cell for refresh counter
And a section for current day tickets(will only show up when the user has tickets for the current day and it will only display 4 tickets)
And a section for next home games(should only display 3 games)
And a section for all future tickets
And a section for ticket transfers(only appears if user has forwarded or received tickets in the past)
And a section for more information
And a button to take the user to Settings > Ticketing Accounts (filtered for club)
And a journal and settings button on the bottom nav bar

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on See All next to the your other tickets section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Full Ticket List view for the next/upcoming event

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a ticket in the other ticket section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Scan View for that specific ticket

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Buy More Tickets button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Buy Tiickets webview for the primary ticket provider

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Upgrades button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the club's upgrade webview

custom_steps_separated.content: When a team doesn't support Upgrades
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Upgrades button will be hidden from view
(NY Yankees on Prod for example)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Manage Tickets button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the club's ticket provider webview

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the refresh arrow next to the timestamp
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the page will refresh
And the timestamp will update

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a game cell in the upcoming games section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Event Detail view for that specific game

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on "see all" button on the next home game section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the home games list view for that ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user is on the home game list view
And the user scrolls though each cell
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should not see any games against itself
And the team logo should be correct for each team

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a game cell in the future ticketed games section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Full Ticket List view for the selected event

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Manage Ticket Accounts button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to Settings > Ticket Accounts > (specific club list)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the ticket dashboard
And the user taps on any game listed with tickets
And the user taps on any of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be on scan view

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the Ticket Dashboard
And sees a time
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the time will be displayed as local time with time zone

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has a parking pass for today
And the user has a regular pass for the same ballpark for today
And the user is on the dashbord
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the parking pass on the ticket dashboard
And it should appear on today's ticket section
And it should appear above all other tickets in the other ticket section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has a parking pass for tomorrow or any other future event
And the user has a regular seat pass for the same event
And the user is on the dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see first 3 passes on the "Other ticket" section
And the user should see the state the passes are in
And the parking passes should always appear above all other passes

title: Use Cases
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the tickets dashboard of a team with native ticketing

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has tickets to next / current event
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be displayed ticket detail info for that event in Ticket Dashboard

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user does not have tickets to next / current event
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be displayed a mini nav for ticket management(buying tickets, upgrading, etc)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has tickets to current event 
And retrieves them while the event is taking place
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be displayed ticket detail info for that event in Ticket Dashboard

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has tickets to the next / current event 
And that event has just been postponed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the ticket will be removed from the app
And the user may have to re link or update his account when the new ticket is added to his account

#*(Need to find out what happens when this occurs, and need to make a ticket for said issue if the AC changes)*#

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has tickets to an event in the future not including the next / current event nor the following 3 events
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see all tickets to all future events in the other ticket section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has linked account for team 
And has tickets for that team but digital access has been disabled for that team via service configuration
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then no tickets are displayed in Ticket Dashboard - buy ticket links are shown
*****AND NOT SURE WHAT EXPECTED BEHAVIOR IS IN ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT SECTION

custom_steps_separated.content: When a subset of the user's tickets have been moved into a scanned state (e.g. scanned at the stadium)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the full ticket list view will display all tickets scanned with an Icon next to each ticket indicating the ticket has been scanned

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user's ticket inventory has changed since the last time the app was refreshed (e.g. they bought a new ticket)
And user taps the refresh button to get their latest inventory
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app refreshes and shows the newly purchased tickets alongside their existing tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the ticket list view
custom_steps_separated.expected: There will be a button in top right of the action bar: Forward (arrow pointing up and to right at a 45 degree angle)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps Forward arrow
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the list will go into selectable mode and a check box for forwardable tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user observes a non forwardable ticket in the list (status: already scanned) and taps on it
custom_steps_separated.expected: The the user will see an indicator (checkmark) next to that ticket and it will not be selectable. An error message will appear "this ticket cannot be forwarded"

custom_steps_separated.content: When user selects a ticket (tapping anywhere in the cell or on the checkbox directly, test both)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Forward button will be enabled and a checkmark will appear in the respective checkbox

custom_steps_separated.content: When user selects a ticket that has already been selected (tapping anywhere in the cell or on the checkbox directly, test both)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the checkmark will disappear in the respective checkbox

custom_steps_separated.content: When user selects a ticket that has already been selected and that ticket was only ticket selected remaining
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Forward button will be disabled and a checkmark will disappear in the respective checkbox

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on Forward button with selected tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken directly to forward via email view and send via link option

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the email form after making some ticket forwarding selections
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the event details and then all of the tickets selected for forwarding from the previous screen displayed below

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to send the multi ticket forward email by tapping on the "paper airplane" icon without entering anything in the email field
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see an error message that an email address is required to forward tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to send the multi ticket forward email by tapping on the "paper airplane" icon without entering a vaild email in the email field (no @ symbol and/or no domain name)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see an error message that a valid email address is required to forward tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to send the multi ticket forward email with a valid email put in but no network and taps on the "paper airplane" icon without a network connection
custom_steps_separated.expected: message " Network Error, Please try again" is displayed

title: Use Cases
custom_preconds: User has accessed the Scan View

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user loses their network connection
And the user accesses the Scan View
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will still have a scannable ticket

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user switches from Scan View to Ticket Back View
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team configuration will always match

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is in the Ticket Back View
And the user swipes left or right
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the ticket will not change

custom_steps_separated.content: When the barcode is set to not available based on club rules
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the scan view will not show a barcode
And instead will show a message stating so

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user scans a ticket
And then scans the ticket again a minute later
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then only the first scan will be accepted

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user scans a ticket in another form (mobile ticket vendor portal, loyalty card, paper)
And then the user attempts to scan the digital ticket in Ballpark app
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the scan in the Ballpark app will be rejected

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user receives a ticket transfer forwarded from another account
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the recipient will be able to scan the ticket successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has successfully scanned a ticket for entry
And then the user attempts to transfer the ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the attempt to forward the ticket will be rejected

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user attempts to scan a ticket
And that ticket has a stored value (money attached)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the scan will complete successfully
And the users stored value remains valid and intact

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has a general admission ticket (no seat, no row)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the scan will complete successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has tickets to a game
And the user kills the app
And the user goes to the ticket dashboard for that ballpark
And the user navigate to the ticket list view
And the user kills network connection
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the ticket should be cached
And the user should be able to see the scan view/ticket back

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has a Ticket Forward in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Forwards module will become visible on the Ticket Dashboard

custom_steps_separated.content: When no Forwards (EVER) are found for the user
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app will hide the Forward module from the Ticket Dashboard

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has completed a Forward in the past
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Forwards module will become visible on the Ticket Dashboard

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the forward Module is visible on the Ticket Dashboard
And the user taps on "received" cell
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the forward received list view
And the user will see a subnav for received and sent(with the received tab highlighted)
And the user will see all the transactions listed under 2 sections "completed" or "cancelled"
And the user will see the following for every transaction:
- date on the top left of each cell in this format - (sunday, may 10 vs reds) will be in BOLD
- section, row, and seat in that order spaced out - will not be BOLD

custom_steps_separated.content: when the user taps on one of the cells found on the forward received list view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be directed to the forward detail view
And the user will see the following:
- back button on the top left
- the header right next to the back button
- team logos on opposite sides of each other the home team logo will appear on the right side
- between the logos at the center will display the game information
* the team names
* date of the game with time
* venue name
- section, row, and seat information
- who sent the ticket (will be displayed as "from:")
- when the ticket was received (will be displayed as "date received:")
- date the tickets were accepted (will be displayed as "date accepted:")
- status of the transaction (will be displayed as "status:")

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user goes back to the ticket forward page
And the user swipes from left to right and vise versa
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be switch between received and sent view

custom_steps_separated.content: when the taps on "sent" on the top nav
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see transactions listed under completed, in progress, and cancelled
And the user will see the following for every transaction:
- date on the top left of each cell in this format - (sunday, may 10 vs reds) will be in BOLD
- section, row, and seat in that order spaced out - will not be BOLDz

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on any of the transactions
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be directed to the forward detail view
And the user will see the following:
- back button on the top left
- the header right next to the back button
- team logos on opposite sides of each other the home team logo will appear on the right side
- between the logos at the center will display the game information
* the team names
* date of the game with time
* venue name
- section, row, and seat information
- who the ticket was sent to(will be displayed as "sent to:")
- when the ticket was sent (will be displayed as "date sent:")
- date the tickets were accepted (will be displayed as "date accepted:")
- status of the transaction (will be displayed as "status:")
- who accepted the ticket(will be displayed as "accepted by:")

custom_steps_separated.content: User selects a ticket to be forwarded to an email address for a user who already has downloaded the app and has a linked ticket account for that team
custom_steps_separated.expected: Ticket should immediately appear in that recipient's ticket dashboard once they refresh their inventory

custom_steps_separated.content: User forwards a ticket and the recipient has accepted
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Ticket no longer shows up in the original owners ticket view
And a record of the forward is displayed in the Sent Transfers section of the app along with the current status of the forward

custom_steps_separated.content: User forwards a ticket to a user who doesn't have the app downloaded
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Prior to the recipient accepting, the original user sees an icon next to that ticket indicating a forward is in progress
And a record of the forward is displayed in the Sent Transfers section of the app along with the current status of the forward
And the recipient user is sent an email telling them to download the app and then hit the link the email
And the email includes a custom message created by the sender
And after downloading the app, user taps the link in the email and is taken to a forward accept page in the app for that ticket

custom_steps_separated.content: User attempts to a forward a ticket that is already part of a in-progress forward
custom_steps_separated.expected: App rejects the request and indicates they must first cancel the existing forward

custom_steps_separated.content: User cancels an inprogress forward before the recipient has accepted
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Record of the forward is displayed in the Sent Transfers with a status of cancelled
And icon no longer shows next to ticket indicating in-progress forward
And user is free to include this ticket in a subsequent forward

custom_steps_separated.content: If the recipient tries to click the link in the email from a cancelled forward
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they should see a page indicating the forward is no longer valid

custom_steps_separated.content:
User has tickets from multiple ticket accounts for one team
And they forward a ticket from each of those accounts
custom_steps_separated.expected: Forward should execute as normal where the correct account is used to execute the forward depending on the account that owned that ticket

title: Data Updates
custom_preconds:
**We can only verify the call being made to Box Office service because they are all ssl and not visible in Charles.

Hard Refresh = Calling the Box Office API to update ticket data from the source and then return it to us
Soft Refresh = Calling the Box Office's currently stored data
Global = Refresh across all ticket accounts

****Refresh Calls:
Hard Refresh = http://4.34.117.10/api/v1/users/ticketDashboard?guid=$%7Bguid%7D&teamID=$%7BteamID%7D&asOfDateTime=$%7BasOfDate&refresh=true
Soft Refresh = http://4.34.117.10/api/v1/users/ticketDashboard?guid=$%7Bguid%7D&teamID=$%7BteamID%7D&asOfDateTime=$%7BasOfDate&refresh=false

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user launches the app for the first time
And views any ticketing data�
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will never see stale ticketing data

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user launches the app from background or a killed state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app will perform a soft refresh

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to Settings > Ticket Accounts
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app will perform a soft refresh

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to Settings > Ticket Accounts
And the user adds an account
Or the user unlinks an account
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app will perform a soft refresh

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to the Ticket Dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app will perform a soft refresh

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to a webview on the Ticket Dashboard
And returns to the Ticket Dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app will perform a hard refresh

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the Ticket Dashboard
And the user initiates a manual refresh
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app will perform a hard refresh

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the Scan View 
And the user initiates a transfer 
OR the user cancels a transfer
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app will perform a soft refresh

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to any ticket list view from the Ticket Dashboard
And the user initiates a manual refresh
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app will perform a hard refresh

title: Timestamps
custom_preconds: Timestamps are displayed on the Ticket Dashboard and Scan views

custom_steps_separated.content: When a refresh of ticketing data is successful
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the timestamp will update
And the time will be shown in "x days ago", "x minutes ago" format

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a refresh of ticketing data fails 
And the failure is network related
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will receive a generic network issue error message

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a refresh of ticketing data fails 
And the failure is data related
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will receive a message "Unable to load data"

title: Linking
custom_preconds: The 'Ticketing Accounts' page can be accessed from the Setting page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to Settings > Ticketing Accounts
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then there will be a button labelled 'Link Account' at the top
And a section for currently linked ticketing accounts

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has ticket accounts linked
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then they will be listed under Ticketing Accounts section
And the data will display name of account, email, and account number
And there will be an 'Unlink' button next to each tickting account

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'Link Account' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they will be taken to the Linking webview

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Linking webview
And the user taps on the dropdown to select a team
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a dropdown with all 30 teams available to be selected

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user selects a team that does not participate (Yankees)
And the user fills in en email address
And the user taps the 'Link Your Account' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will receive a message stating, 'Account linking is not currently supported with this team.'
And there will be a 'return' button
And tapping that will bring you back to the select a team page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user selects a team that does participate (Mariners)
And the user fills in en email address
And the user taps the 'Link Your Account' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will receive a message to check their email to confirm the link
Or the user will be advised that a ticketing account doesn't exist for that email address/team combo

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Linking webview
And the user taps 'Done' on bottom right
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be returned to the Ticketing Accounts page
And a refresh with occur

custom_steps_separated.content: Use the account linking webview to connect an existing TDC (and TM) account. Click link in verification email to complete the account linking process
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Account appears linked in the Manage Accounts section of Ballpark
And tickets owned by that account are displayed in Ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content: Use the account linking webview to connect an existing ticketing account. Wait > 15 minutes until clicking the link in the verification email such that it is expired and account linking fails
custom_steps_separated.expected: You're given a message indicating the account linking has failed and you should retry

custom_steps_separated.content: Use the account linking webview to connect multiple TDC (and TM) accounts from different teams
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Account appears linked in the Manage Accounts section of Ballpark
And tickets owned by all accounts are displayed in Ballpark depending on the team context you're currently viewing

custom_steps_separated.content: Unlink an account from the Manage Accounts section of Ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Account appears unlinked in the Manage Accounts section of Ballpark
And no tickets  are displayed in Ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content: Using an MLBAM account that has already been linked to a TDC account (a.k.a. reverse linked via Patron Integration), log into Ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Account no longer appears in the Manage Accounts section of Ballpark
And tickets owned by this account are not displayed in Ballpark

title: Buy Tickets Only
custom_preconds:
Some clubs who do not wish to offer full Digital Access can still utilize MyTickets Mobile or TM management portal within the event module.

These teams will display a Tickets tab that allows users to buy tickets with a full event index similar in style to the Digital Access teams.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to a team with digital access disabled
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will still see a Tickets sub nav

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps or swipes to Tickets in sub nav
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Buy Tickets Only view

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Buy Tickets Only view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see an event info cell at the top
And that cell will contain matchup info for the current/next game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the 'Buy' button
Or the user taps on the cell for any upcoming games listed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to a webview 
And that webview will allow to purchase tickets for the specified event

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the 'View Full Schedule' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Event List webview
And there will be a way to purchase tickets for each game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Buy Tickets Only view
And the user scrolls to the bottom
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a More Ticketing Info section
And it will contain the club's supplemental ticketing webviews

title: Ticket Dashboard
custom_preconds:
Given the Major leagues are in the offseason
And the user is on the ticket dashboard
custom_steps:
NOTE:
This test case should be modified when https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-1545 designs are applied

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following:
- the more information module (at the top)
- ticket forward module (directly below)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has chosen a game that has Native Ticket Purchase enabled (see entry points test suite for more details)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to a selection of tickets from that specific game "Featured Tickets"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user examines the Featured Tickets view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see team nickname matchup, event date and time (home stadium timezone), Ticket quantity filter and View More in the header section. 
In the rows, user will see stadium map and seat view along with the ticket price in whole dollar amounts.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the ticket quantity filter
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is able to search for tickets in different quantities by changing the highlighted number. The user will also be able to cancel the filter changes or follow a weblink to look for Accessible Seats outside the Ballpark app

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user applies the new quantity filter selection
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the featured tickets view is updated to only show Featured tickets that have the new availability chosen by the user

e.g. if the user has now selected 10 tickets, a Featured ticket selection that does not have 10 connected seats will no longer be shown in the view

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on View More
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to the More view where they will see team nickname matchup, event date and time (home stadium timezone), Ticket quantity and price filter. Below the user should see a list of all sections with the ticket price in whole dollar amounts

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a row
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see that price become highlighted and the image area will update to show either the stadium map or seat view

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the image button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the image will switch between the seat view and the stadium map location image

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the ticket and price filter button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is able to search for tickets in different quantities by changing the highlighted number. The user is able to move the price slider to change their price range (as of 5.1 this is only for max price, not minimum) The user will also be able to cancel the filter changes or follow a weblink to look for Accessible Seats outside the Ballpark app

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects a different quantity and price range
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the ticket results are updated so that they are filtered to that particular price range where there is ticket availability in the quantity the user requested

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user adds tickets to their shopping cart
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then those tickets are locked for a set time, this time appears in the header and counts down

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user leaves the shopping cart before making a purchase
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the selected tickets are returned to the inventory so they can be selected by other customers

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is in the shopping cart and reviews the tax field
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the appropriate taxes are applied

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is in the shopping cart and reviews the tax field
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the appropriate fees are applied

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on select payment and elects to add a new payment
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a credit card entry form is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user enters data on the credit card form
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then each of the fields validates as expected:
Credit card number will display credit card type when validated (e.g. Visa, Mastercard, American Express)
Expiration date checks for a valid date (no past dates)
CSV/CVV has a 4 character limit
Address fields are required
State/Province drop down selection is required

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects a previously used credit card or payment method
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then that payment method is automatically loaded and ready to use for checkout

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to checkout with a saved credit card
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a CSV/CVV popup appears where the user is required to enter the security code then taken to the order confirmation page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to checkout with a new credit card
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then no additional popups appear for security card, the user will be taken directly to the order confirmation page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the reservation timer expires on any of the following pages:
Shopping cart
Payment method selection
Add Credit Card
What is a CVV
Disclaimer
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a non dismissable dialog appears that will push the user back to the featured tickets view and their ticket selection(s) is returned to the inventory

custom_steps_separated.content: When the reservation timer expires while Ballpark is backgrounded and the user returns to the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the timeout is handled the same as if the user had been in the app > non dismissable dialog that returns to the featured view

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user back navigates from the shopping cart
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a pop up message appears to warn the user they will lose their reservation on the selected tickets "Warning
The tickets on hold will be released if you cancel the order." 
With the option to "Stay On This Page" and "Cancel Order"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user chooses to stay on their order page after receiving the warning
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user can continue to review their ticket selections and make changes to their payment method without losing their reservation, the timer is not interrupted

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user chooses to cancel their order after receiving the warning
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken back to either the Featured Tickets or More Tickets view, wherever they had made their selection to enter the shopping cart. When making a subsequent selection the user should see a fresh reservation timer

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user enters the first 4 digits of a Visa, Mastercard, Discover or American Express
see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bank_card_number
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the card type is recognized and the appropriate image appears

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user enters the first 4 digits of a credit card that is not accepted
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then messaging appears to indicate to the user which credit card types are supported

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user chooses to save credit card to the team account with a valid credit card and completes a checkout
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the next time the user brings tickets to the shopping cart the previously saved credit card will be available to chose

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has a valid saved credit card selected and taps on Pay Now on the shopping cart
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is prompted to enter the security code (CVV/CSV)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the security code entry popup
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user can successfully dismiss the popup with back button or enter a valid security code to complete the purchase (invalid codes will not be accepted)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user chooses to save credit card to the team account with a valid credit card and does not complete a checkout
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the next time the user brings tickets to the shopping cart that previously entered credit card will NOT be available to chose

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user chooses not to save credit card to the team account with a valid credit card and completes a checkout
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the next time the user brings tickets to the shopping cart that previously entered credit card will NOT be available to chose

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user chooses to save credit card to the team account with an invalid credit card, then tries to checkout with invalid card, user should see the invalid card error. Then backs out of the shopping cart and re-enters the cart with a new selection
(This case is basically checking if the user tries to make a purchase with a card that does not work it won't be saved for future use)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will NOT see an invalid credit card saved as a payment method

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to enter the Native Ticket Purchase flow and there is an error on first load of data (may need developer to assist in creating this scenario)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is automatically pushed to the web ticket purchasing flow

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to progress through the Native Ticket Purchase flow when the config is invalid (may need developer to assist in creating this scenario)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Restart session error is triggered, message appears "We're sorry, something went wrong! Please try again." along with a OK or Continue button that will place the user to a list of tickets they last saw.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to progress through the Native Ticket Purchase flow when the selected tickets are invalid or corrupted in some way
custom_steps_separated.expected: Restart session error is triggered, message appears "We're sorry, something went wrong! Please try again." along with a OK or Continue button that will place the user to a list of tickets they last saw.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user submits a payment and the system experiences a temporary error (e.g. network connection was lost)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be presented with a message saying there was a temporary problem and be allowed to reattempt to submit the payment, this option will not require additional input as the selections made previously will be resent from memory

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user takes an action and there is a transitory systems issue
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is shown a message "Something went wrong! Try request again?" ,"try again" action (repeats last request) or "start over" action (restarts session)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user submits a payment and the system responds with a Bad Payment Instrument or Bad Checkout Input: User type error
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then display a dialog indicating that there was a problem with their payment and to edit or choose another payment method

Sample "There was a problem with the payment method you selected. Please update your payment info or select another payment method."

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is presented with a payment method error when attempting to pay with a new credit card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then display a dialog indicating that there was a problem with their payment and to edit or choose another payment method

Sample "There was a problem with the payment method you selected. Please update your payment info or select another payment method."

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is presented with a payment method error when attempting to pay with a saved credit card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then display a dialog indicating that there was a problem with their payment and to edit or choose another payment method

Sample "There was a problem with the payment method you selected. Please update your payment info or select another payment method."

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is presented with a payment method error when attempting to pay with invalid  expiration date
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then display a dialog indicating that there was a problem with their payment and to edit or choose another payment method

Sample "There was a problem with the payment method you selected. Please update your payment info or select another payment method."

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is presented with a payment method error when attempting to pay with invalid zip code
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then display a dialog indicating that there was a problem with their payment and to edit or choose another payment method

Sample "There was a problem with the payment method you selected. Please update your payment info or select another payment method."

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user takes an action and the system returns a Patron Account error
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a "retry or start again" type message, whatever option is selected Ballpark will refresh the patron account info from Box Office. Then if retry, the last request is repeated or if start again the session returns to the beginning

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Ballpark Guide page and taps on the "Buy Tickets" button below the next event module while NTP flow is off
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the selected team's ticket purchasing website in a webview.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the game row in the Native Schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Ticket Event Details page where matchup data is displayed (with team logos), Promotions and Offers are viewable
There will also be a Buy Tickets button if the game has NTP enabled and tickets are still on sale

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the "Buy Tickets" button at the bottom of the Ticket Event Details page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the native purchasing flow is launched for that particular event and the Feature Tickets page is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Ballpark Guide page and taps on the "Schedule" button below the team ballpark image
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to a native schedule view with all of the selected team's home games listed in chronological order. The games will show the date, opponent and have a "T" button.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the "Full" selector in the Native Schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then all of the games for the selected team will now be displayed including away games

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a "T" (tickets) link next to a game listed in the native schedule view from both Home and Full schedule views
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the native purchasing flow is launched for that particular event and the Feature Tickets page is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Ticket Dashboard and taps on the Buy Tickets button below the next event top pane
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought directly to the Feature Tickets page with tickets shown for the next event at the currently selected ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Event Details view and taps on the Buy Tickets row
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought directly to the Feature Tickets page with tickets shown for that event

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user attempts to enter the NTP flow when the game is no longer selling tickets (game is in the past)
Check the previous three entry points in the above steps - Native Schedule T-link, Ticket Dashboard "Buy Tickets", Event Details "Buy Tickets" row
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the selected team's ticket purchasing website in a webview.

title: Display T-links
custom_preconds:
Display ticket icon / buy tickets button (Event Detail) if:
QNTP ON (Ballpark config is enabled, mlbFlow is ON, event is not in the excluded list)
QNTP is ON and the event is in the excluded list, but the T-Link value is populated in the response
QNTP is OFF and the T-Link value is populated in the response
Do NOT display ticket icon if:
QNTP is OFF and no T-Link is present in the response
QNTP is ON, event is in excluded list and no T-Link value is in the response

title: Hide T-links
custom_preconds:
Display ticket icon / buy tickets button (Event Detail) if:
QNTP ON (Ballpark config is enabled, mlbFlow is ON, event is not in the excluded list)
QNTP is ON and the event is in the excluded list, but the T-Link value is populated in the response
QNTP is OFF and the T-Link value is populated in the response
Do NOT display ticket icon if:
QNTP is OFF and no T-Link is present in the response
QNTP is ON, event is in excluded list and no T-Link value is in the response
